Event: Why Culture Matters? International Symposium centers around three main themes: material and immaterial heritage, relationships between center and periphery, and migration. Bringing together actors involved in projects and initiatives related to these topics, the symposium proposes to its participants to reflect on how culture (in its several dimensions: as a product, as a process, and as an instrument) interacts with and is shaped by them in the exceptional context of Timișoara 2023 - European Capital of Culture.
speakers heading: The Why Culture Matters? International Symposium brings to Timișoara experts in the field of cultural heritage protection, and professionals in social, cultural & public policies.
joint effort: Why Culture Matters? International Symposium is part of “A Week For Monuments” program that combines local, national and international initiatives that approach material and immaterial heritage in various ways, with the purpose of creating a holistic image of the role that heritage and culture plays in the life of a community.
organization explained: As a joint-event of the cultural projects
AFCN disclaimer: * The project does not necessarily represent the position of the National Cultural Fund Administration. AFCN is not responsible for the content of the project or how the results of the project may be used. These are entirely the responsibility of the beneficiary of the funding.

GDPR:
By completing this form, you agree that the Prin Banat Association will process personal data for the sole purpose of your attendance in the Why Culture Matters? International Symposium.

Throughout the duration of the symposium, photo and video sequences will be recorded, a situation that will incidentally also lead to the processing of personal data representing photo/ video images of the participants in this event. By participating in the Why Culture Matters? International Symposium, you give your consent for all audio / photo / video / written materials to be used / transmitted / displayed / published on media and social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, etc.), on the Prin Banat Association website and on its social media accounts as well as its partners and in other future events/projects.
